#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Safely Eat a Carolina Reaper Pepper
#Text=The Carolina Reaper
#Text=Pepper is the world ’s spiciest pepper at 1.5 million Scoville Units .

#Text=Due to this notorious distinction , many individuals on YouTube and other social media formats have taken on the “ Carolina Reaper Pepper Challenge ” in which they attempt to consume this pepper .

#Text=Although such efforts are carried out with the purpose of entertainment , serious precautions need to be taken into consideration in order to ensure safety for the person eating a Carolina Reaper Pepper and surrounding people .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Gauging Your Ability to Eat Spicy Food
#Text=Consume a serving of a spicy snack food .
#Text=Any irritation in your mouth , stomach , or eyes in response to consumption of these items is a likely indication of low spice tolerance and signal to avoid eating a Carolina Reaper Pepper .
#Text=Eat a serving of a spicier item such as a jalapenos if the item from step 1 was consumed comfortably .
#Text=If these spicier items can be comfortably consumed , it is likely safe to proceed with eating a Carolina Reaper Pepper under the right precautions .
#Text=If discomfort is experienced , chew on a slice of bread to remove spicy chemicals from taste buds .
#Text=Eat a serving of an even spicier item such as cayenne pepper if Step 2 was consumed comfortably .
#Text=If discomfort is experienced , drink milk to remove the heat .
#Text=Setting up for the Event
#Text=Purchase the Carolina Reaper Pepper from an online store , as it is often not sold in grocery stores .
#Text=Online stores like PuckerButt Pepper Company and Amazon are reliable options , as they provide packaging costing $ 1 - 2 per Carolina Reaper Pepper .
#Text=Buy a gallon of milk , antacids , and towel from a local grocery store if necessary .
#Text=The milk and antacids help deal with the discomfort of consuming the pepper while the towel help to clean up a potential mess .
#Text=Consuming the Pepper
#Text=Have a light meal prior to consuming the pepper .
#Text=Such a precaution significantly decreases the likelihood of throwing up food that is being digested .
#Text=A slow-digesting item like meat or oatmeal is recommended .
#Text=Mentally calm down before eating the pepper .
#Text=Stress has been shown to worsen an individual 's response to spicy foods .
#Text=Eat only one pepper at a time , not multiple .
#Text=Consuming more than one pepper greatly increases the potential for body irritation and health danger .
#Text=Avoid making tongue contact with the seeds and inner pepper , instead mainly contacting the outer flesh of the pepper .
#Text=The seeds and associated inner flesh contain the highest capsaicin content , making them the spiciest portion of the pepper as capsaicin is the component that gives a spicy flavor .
#Text=Thoroughly chew the pepper .
#Text=Swallowing prematurely without fully breaking the pepper down greatly increases the risk of stomach discomfort .
#Text=After Eating the Pepper
#Text=Slowly drink milk if any irritation is felt in the mouth area .
#Text=Milk contains casein that binds to capsaicin , neutralizing its spicy effect .
#Text=Consume antacids if any stomach pain is felt more than an hour after pepper consumption .
#Text=Antacids will help to reduce feelings of heartburn and other stomach discomforts .
#Text=Receive medical attention if stomach pain is felt more than an hour after pepper consumption .
#Text=Such a prolonged body response necessitates medical treatment .
#Text=Wash your hands .
#Text=Capsaicin residue can remain on fingers after pepper consumption and can lead to skin irritation in certain areas for the person who consumed the pepper and other individuals .
#Text=Use a rag to clean the table or other areas that the pepper has touched .
#Text=Such areas can contain capsaicin residue and be harmful to those individuals who come into contact with them .
